title: Bug 49890: Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
description: Issue: Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform. Attached file: 25997 [details]NioEndpoint.java and simple web application. Sometimes, the server's CPU reaches 100% and remains at 100% until the server is restarted. Reproduced with Java versions: 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021. Identified as a duplicate of issue: Bug 46373. It appears that the problem was fixed by the Jetty team: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel. Additional logging has been added to NioEndpoint.java.
OB: Occasionally, when using logging in NioEndpoint.java, the selector.select(timeout) method returns zero keys on the Linux platform.
EB: To reproduce this JVM bug, multiple requests need to be made to the web application (simply pressing F5 in the browser and holding the button should suffice).
SR:
Steps to Reproduce: 
1. Access the web application.
2. Press and hold the F5 key in the browser for several requests.
3. Observe the server's CPU usage and note any instances where it reaches 100%.
